resource.displayName: Zhang/Gardner P. falciparum 3D7 mixed asexual stage ESTs
resource.pluginArgs: --sourceIdRegex ">(\w+)" --fastaFile @dataDir@/pfc.fasta --externalDatabaseName %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --SOTermName 'EST' --ncbiTaxId 36329 --libraryStrain '3D7' --libraryStage 'Asexual stage' --libraryVector 'pOTB7b' --contactName 'Malcolm Gardner' --contactAddress1 'Seattle Biomedical Research Institute' --contactAddress2 '307 Westlake Avenue N., Suite 500 Seattle, WA 98109-5219' --libraryName 'Zhang/Gardner Pf 3D7 mixed asexual' --libraryDesc "CDNA was prepared from polyA+ RNA using the SMART cDNA Library Construction Kit and was cloned into the pOTB7b vector, a derivative of pOTB7 (1.8 kb) in which a SfiI stuffer fragment was inserted between the BamHI and XhoI sites of pOTB7.PFOCB48 indicates plate and well. T indicates dye terminator chemistry. F and R indicates M13 forward and reverse primers.The R primer is at the 3' polyA end of the mRNA."
resource.description: Hanbang Zhang and Malcolm Gardner P. falciparum 3D7 mixed asexual stage EST library.

resource.displayName: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes sequence and annotation
resource.description: Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The new annotation for P. falciparum 3D7 genome started in October 2007 with a weeklong workshop co-organized by staff from the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (WTSI) and the EuPathDB team. The Wellcome Trust and Burroughs Wellcome Fund-sponsored workshop was held in Hinxton, UK and was attended by nearly 30 Plasmodium researchers contributing expertise in various aspects of Plasmodium biology, plus more than 10 bioinformatics support staff from the Artemis, GeneDB and EuPathDB teams. Ongoing annotation and error checking is being carried out by the GeneDB group from WTSI.

resource.displayName: P. falicparum Sanger chromosomes DBRefs
resource.description: P. falciparum Sanger chromosomes DBRefs.

resource.displayName: P. falciparum 3D7 protein GO Associations

resource.pluginArgs: --externalDatabaseSpec "%EXT_DB_NAME%|%EXT_DB_RLS_VER%" --inputFile @dataDir@/gene_association.Pfalciparum --goExternalDatabaseSpec "Gene Ontology|@goVer@" --seqIdSql "SELECT g.source_id, taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.genefeature g, dots.transcript t, dots.translatedAAFeature taf WHERE g.na_feature_id = t.parent_id AND t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id UNION SELECT taf.source_id, taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.translatedAAFeature taf" --targetTable "DoTS::TranslatedAASequence" --lineOfEvidence "GeneDB" --inputIdColumn id --tolerateMissingSeqs --skipBadGOTerms badGOTerms.log

resource.displayName: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes annotation, PlasmoDB version 5.5
resource.unpack: for f in `ls @dataDir@/data.exchange`; do cat @dataDir@/data.exchange/$f | adjustPlasmoEmblFile" > @dataDir@/data.exchange/$f.fixed; cat @dataDir@/data.exchange/$f.fixed | perl -pe 's/MAL(\d+ standard)/Pf3D7_0$1/' | perl -pe 's/Pf3D7_01([01234] standard)/Pf3D7_1$1/' | perl -pe 's/(\/systematic_id="[^"]+)/$1_v5.5/' > @dataDir@/fixed/$f.fixed; done
resource.pluginArgs: --extDbName %EXT_DB_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --mapFile isf/PlasmoDB/sangerFeatures2gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @dataDir@/fixed --fileFormat embl --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Plasmodium falciparum 3D7" --naSequenceSubclass ExternalNASequence --seqIdColumn source_id --handlerExternalDbs "enzyme:enzymeDB:2009-02-11" --seqExtDbName "Sanger P. falciparum chromosomes" --seqExtDbRlsVer "2009-02-19"
resource.description: Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, TIGR/NRMC, and Stanford University. This data has sequence updates for chromosomes 6, 7 , 8 and 13. For more information see the GeneDB 3D7 News Archive. Includes sequence updates to TIGR chromsomes 2, 10, 11 and 14. Originally described in Gardner et al. Nature 419:498, 2002. Also includes centromere features and curated Gene Ontology and E.C. number associations to genes.

resource.displayName: DBRefs for Entrez gene links

resource.displayName: DBRefs for Phenotype db links
resource.description: Phenotype links from Genetically Modified Rodent Malaria Parasites: Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The database not only provides information on 'successful' mutants with a clear phenotype, but also (un)published mutants without a clear phenotype and (un)published negative trials to disrupt genes.

resource.displayName: DBxRefs for P. falciparum protein functional interactions
resource.description: Using a number of computational and experimental functional genomics datasets, we have reconstructed the functional interaction network of the human malarial parasite P. falciparum. Network data and associated queries are available at the plasmoMAP website.

resource.displayName: P. falciparum protein functional interactions
resource.description: Using a number of computational and experimental functional genomics datasets, we have reconstructed the functional interaction network of the human malarial parasite P. falciparum. Network data and associated queries are available at the plasmoMAP website.

resource.displayName: Phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum
resource.description: Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of all known P. falciparum ORFs in 164 completely sequenced genomes were calculated. Similarity between profiles is a good indicator of functional linkages between proteins (see Pellegrini et al., 1999). Data on ORFs with the most similar profiles to a given query ORF is also available, and can be used to establish the function of uncharacterized ORFs, based on the similarity of their profiles (see Date and Marcotte, 2003) with ORFs of known function.

resource.displayName: Phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum (mutual information scores)
resource.description: Mutual information, an entropy based, information theoretic measure, was used to measure similarity between phylogenetic profiles. This measure is more sensitive, and can detect inverse or non-linear relationships, as opposed to using simpler metrics such as Pearson correlation (Date and Marcotte, 2003).

resource.displayName: Genbank references for chromsome sequences
resource.extDbRlsDescrip: The GenBank version used by Entrez Genome for the creation of the pfChrDbRefs.txt file

resource.displayName: P. falciparum Evigan Gene Models
resource.pluginArgs: --extDbName %EXT_DB_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --mapFile isf/TIGRGffFeatures2gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @dataDir@/Evigan_pf_nbest_chr_forImport.gff --fileFormat gff2 --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Plasmodium falciparum 3D7" --gff2GroupTag "GenePrediction" --naSequenceSubclass ExternalNASequence --seqIdColumn source_id --handlerExternalDbs "enzyme:enzymeDB:@enzymeDBVer@" --seqExtDbName "Sanger P. falciparum chromosomes" --seqExtDbRlsVer "@pfSangerChrVer@"
resource.description: Evigan is a eukaryotic gene predictor which produces consensus gene models by integrating multiple sources of evidence. Evigan can incorporate various types of evidence such as gene models predicted by gene finders, EST matches, protein-to-genome alignment, etc. Employing a Dynamic Bayesian Network(DBN), Evigan makes predictions by infering the most likely consensus gene models given observed source evidence. Its model parameters are estimated by the Expectation-Maximization(EM) algorithm, eliminating the need of curated training data. Click here to get more information.

resource.displayName: updating secondary score for evigan gene models
Isolate barcode data from Broad
resource.description: The Genotyping Barcode is based on 24 different high frequency SNPs (minor allele frequency > 30%) in P. falciparum. These were selected from whole genome sequencing and affymetrix genotyping of P. falciparum strains from around the globe. The method itself uses the TaqMan SNP genotyping assay.

resource.displayName: Isolate genotyping data generated from a 3k snp chip from Broad
resource.description: The 3K genotyping chip is an affymetrix array containing ~3000 SNPs (about two thirds are from chromosome 7 and the rest are distributed throughout the genome).

resource.displayName: Isolate genotyping data generated from a 75k snp chip from Broad
resource.description: 75k SNP chip data from the Broad. There appear to be ~17500 informative snps.
IsolatesByCountry

resource.displayName: MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor)
resource.description: MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E).

resource.displayName: load MAPP With Sqlldr
resource.description: MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E).

resource.displayName: Scripps Malaria GeneChip
resource.description: Custom GeneChip for P. falciparum (taken from GEO record GPL1892)

resource.displayName: Karolinska Institutet MTC P. falciparum Oligo Array
resource.description: ArrayExpress (A-MEXP-75). The 70-mer oligonucleotides microarray consisted of 6850 probes. From there, 6542 probes (Malaria Genome Oligo Set Version 1.0) were designed and synthesized by Qiagen Operon and 14 probes were obtained from the SpotReport Alien oligo array validation system (Stratagene, CA, USA). The rest of the oligos were selected using ArrayDesigner Version 1 (Premier Biosoft International, CA, USA). Oligonucleotides were dissolved in 1:3 of DMSO:dH2O at a final concentration of 40 M in preparation for spotting on CMT-UltraGaps slides. Microarraying was done by Genetix Qarray. Each probe was printed in quadruplicate on the slides.

resource.displayName: 3D7AH1S2 vs. 3D7S8.4 (ring, trophozite and schizont) - meta data
resource.description: Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

resource.displayName: 3D7AH1S1 vs. 3D7S8.4 AND 3D7AH1S3 vs. 3D7S8.4 (ring) - meta data
resource.description: P. falciparum cellline experiment: CD36 panned clones (Ring) were hybridized against S8.4 (Ring)

resource.displayName: Identification of genome wide gene copy number polymorphisms in Plasmodium falciparum - meta data
resource.description: Identification of genome wide gene copy number polymorphisms in P. falciparum by comparative genomic hybridizations on an oligonucleotide microarray. The 3D7 strain was used as a common reference in all strain/strain comparisons. A panel of the strains were hybridized to self in order to estimate the level of noise.

resource.displayName: Tetracyclines Specifically Target the Apicoplast of the Malaria Parasite Plasmodium falciparum - meta data

manualGet.institution: Biochemistry and Biophysics, University of California San Francisco

resource.description: To characterize the antimalarial mechanism of tetracyclines, evaluated their stage-specific activities, impacts on parasite transcription, and effects on two predicted organelle targets, the apicoplast and the mitochondrion, in cultured P. falciparum.

resource.displayName: Whole genome analysis of mRNA decay in P. falciparum - meta data

resource.displayName: P. falciparum invasion pathways - array data

manualGet.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'Molecular mechanism for switching of P.falciparum invasion pathways into human erythrocytes' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/1.0/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory 1.0
resource.description: The malaria parasite, P. falciparum, exploits multiple ligand-receptor interactions, called invasion pathways, to invade the host erythrocyte. Strains of P. falciparum vary in their dependency on sialated red cell receptors for invasion. We show that switching from sialic acid-dependent to independent invasion is reversible and depends on parasite ligand utilisation. Expression of reticulocyte-binding like homologue 4 (PfRh4) correlates with sialic acid-independent invasion and PfRh4 is essential for switching invasion pathways. Differential activation of PfRh4 represents a novel mechanism of invasion pathway control and provides P.falciparum with exquisite adaptability in the face of erythrocyte receptor polymorphisms and host immune responses. (taken from GEO record GSE2878)

resource.displayName: P. falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout - array data

manualGet.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/1.0/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/1.0
resource.description: Expression profiling of 3D7 silent information regulator 2 homolog (Sir2) knockout at ring stage, 8 hours post-invasion. Results identify Sir2-mediated, reversible heterochromatin silencing as one tier of epigenetic regulation of the antigenic variation var gene family. (taken from GEO record GDS1350)

resource.displayName: Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites - array data

manualGet.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/1.0/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/1.0
resource.description: Analysis of reticulocyte binding-like homolog 2b (PfRh2b) null mutant 3D7 parasites. D10 isolate naturally lacks PfRh2b. Silencing of PfRh2b, a key invasion ligand, leads to altered invasion receptor dependency. Results provide insight into the molecular basis for invasion via an alternate pathway. (taken from GEO record GDS2346)

resource.displayName: Comparison of Various P. falciparum Knock outs - Invasion Pathways

manualGet.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

resource.displayName: 3D7AH1S2 vs. 3D7S8.4 (ring, trophozite and schizont) - array data
resource.description: Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

resource.displayName: 3D7AH1S1 vs. 3D7S8.4 AND 3D7AH1S3 vs. 3D7S8.4 (ring) - array data

resource: --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%EXT_DB_NAME%|%EXT_DB_RLS_VER%" P. falciparum cellline experiment: CD36 panned clones (Ring) were hybridized against S8.4 (Ring)

resource.displayName: Identification of genome wide gene copy number polymorphisms in Plasmodium falciparum - array data
resource.description: Identification of genome wide gene copy number polymorphisms in P. falciparum by comparative genomic hybridizations on an oligonucleotide microarray. The 3D7 strain was used as a common reference in all strain/strain comparisons. A panel of the strains were hybridized to self in order to estimate the level of noise.

resource.displayName: Tetracyclines Specifically Target the Apicoplast of the Malaria Parasite Plasmodium falciparum - array data

manualGet.institution: Biochemistry and Biophysics, University of California San Francisco

resource.description: To characterize the antimalarial mechanism of tetracyclines, evaluated their stage-specific activities, impacts on parasite transcription, and effects on two predicted organelle targets, the apicoplast and the mitochondrion, in cultured P. falciparum.

resource.displayName: Whole genome analysis of mRNA decay in P. falciparum - array data

manualGet.institution: Biochemistry and Biophysics, University of California San Francisco

resource.description: Whole genome analysis of mRNA decay in P. falciparum reveals a global lengthening of mRNA half-life during the intraerythrocytic development cycle.

resource.displayName: Plasmodium falciparum W2/Dd2 Day 8 gametocytes - array data
resource.description: To characterize the antimalarial mechanism of tetracyclines, evaluated their stage-specific activities, impacts on parasite transcription, and effects on two predicted organelle targets, the apicoplast and the mitochondrion, in cultured P. falciparum.

resource.displayName: S8.4 vs. AH1S2 (Ring, Schizont, Trophozite) Expression Analysis
Distinct physiological states of Plasmodium falciparum in malaria infected patients - expression profiles
resource.description: To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported custom made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.

resource.displayName: Distinct physiological states of Plasmodium falciparum in malaria infected patients
resource.description: To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported cust om made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.

Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establ ishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones ( 3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fif teen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 c ompared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DN A/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w , PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other varian t gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of tran scripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones whil e the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcrip tional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

resource.displayName: P.falciparum RNA Sequence Profiles(Newbold)
resource.description: Expression data for the P. falciparum RNA Sequence generated by the Newbold lab.

resource.displayName: P.falciparum gene expression profiles (Newbold)
resource.description: Plasmodium falciparum directly from the blood of infected individuals was cultured to examine patterns of mature-stage gene expression in patient isolates. Statistical estimation of cell-cycle progression and lineage commitment in Plasmodium falciparum reveals a homogeneous pattern of transcription in ex vivo culture, data provided by Chris I. Newbold, Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine, Molecular Parasitology Group.

resource.displayName: P. falciparum proteomics data from clinical samples (Tatu)
resource.description: Data produced by proteomics analysis of clinical isolates of early stages of P. falciparum. Patient derived malarial parasites were directly processed and analyzed using shotgun proteomics approach using high sensitivity mass spectrometry for protein identification. Utpal Tatu, Department of Biochemistry, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, karnataka, India.

resource.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Henk Stunnenberg
resource.description: ChIP-on-chip profiling of H3, H3K4me3, H3K9me3, and H3K9ac of P. falciparum from asynchronous parasites revealed an extensively euchromatic epigenome with heterochromatin restricted to variant surface antigen gene families (VSA) and a number of genes hitherto unlinked to VSA. Contact Henk Stunnenberg, h.stunnenberg@ncmls.ru.nl, NCMLS Radboud Universiteit.

resource.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Artur Scherf

manualGet.institution: Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite

resource.description: Chromatin immunoprecipitation to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum wild type and Sir2 knock-outs. Contact Artur Scherf, artur.scherf@pasteur.fr, Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite.

resource.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray - Till Voss
resource.description: Genome-wide association of Pf Heterochromatin protein 1 (Hp-1) with virulence gene clusters. We identified 425 PfHP1-bound genes by ChIP-on-CHIP - almost all of which code for expor ted (predicted) virulence genes including all var genes, rifs, stevor, pfmc-2tm and others. Contact Till Voss, till.voss@unibas.ch, for further information
